A player wielding a shotgun can defeat a player with a hammer in the middle of his melee lunge, but in the Campaign, the hammer is more effective than the shotgun against tough enemies like Brutes and Hunters. Though an enemy player wielding a hammer may at first seem defenseless, the shockwave emitted when the hammer is swung can actually bat away grenades and even It is mainly used for transportation but different variations can serve many purposes, such as hurling respawning objects towards players or other objects.","description":"<h2>Overview<\/h2><br\/><h3>Stationary Gravity Lift<\/h3><br\/>The stationary Gravity Lift is the most commonly known version, as it has appeared in all <a data-ref-id=\"3025-2\" href=\"\/halo\/3025-2\/\" slug=\"halo\">Halo<\/a> games. It is a large structure built into the architecture of a given location and acts as an elevator to transport someone to another floor of a building. It typically makes a sound when being used. Stationary Gravity Lifts can be found mostly on multiplayer maps such as <a data-ref-id=\"3035-1213\" href=\"\/guardian\/3035-1213\/\" slug=\"guardian\">Guardian<\/a>, <a data-ref-id=\"3035-1194\" href=\"\/blackout\/3035-1194\/\" slug=\"blackout\">Blackout<\/a>, and <a data-ref-id=\"3035-238\" href=\"\/lockout\/3035-238\/\" slug=\"lockout\">Lockout<\/a>.<br\/><br\/><h3>Deployable Gravity Lift<\/h3><br\/>In <a data-ref-id=\"3030-9993\" href=\"\/halo-3\/3030-9993\/\" slug=\"halo-3\">Halo 3<\/a> the deployable <span>Gravity Lift<\/span> was introduced as a piece of equipment. Wherever it is thrown, anything moving over it will be thrust vertically into the air. Where the person or object goes after being thrust depends on its momentum in a given direction. It only functions for a limited time however, and it can be destroyed by weapons or explosives.<br\/><br\/><h3>Forge Gravity Lift<\/h3><br\/>A third type of Gravity Lift was also introduced in Halo 3, which can only be placed in the Forge Map Editor. This gravity lift propels players or objects moving over it in a predefined direction, set by whoever created the map in the Forge
